definition: post horse
post horse/relay station
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Still, there were young men willing to ride for the Pony Express.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，仍然有年轻男士愿意在驿马快信公司当差。

sentences.english: Pony Express rider could do it in ten days.
sentences.chinese: 驿马信使在十日之内就能把信送到。

sentences.english: Besides riders, other people helped run the Pony Express.
sentences.chinese: 除了骑士，经营驿马快信公司还需要其他的人手。

sentences.english: The Pony Express was much faster than the stagecoach.
sentences.chinese: 驿马快信要比当时的公共马车快多了。

definition: the Yuezhi, an ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty (also written 月氏[Yue4 zhi1])
typical weather in a given season
wealth/money
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
the 12 earthly branches 子[zi3], 丑[chou3], 寅[yin2], 卯[mao3], 辰[chen2], 巳[si4], 午[wu3], 未[wei4], 申[shen1], 酉[you3], 戌[xu1], 亥[hai4], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
Mandate of Heaven/the Grand Canal, 1800 km from Beijing to Hangzhou, built starting from 486 BC/usually written 大運河|大运河[Da4 Yun4 he2]
11th earthly branch: 7-9 p.m., 9th solar month (8th October-6th November), year of the Dog/ancient Chinese compass point: 300°
see 屈戌兒|屈戌儿[qu1 qu5 er5]
sealed ribbon fastening correspondence (in former times)
unlucky/inauspicious/ominous
the 10 heavenly stems 甲[jia3], 乙[yi3], 丙[bing3], 丁[ding1], 戊[wu4], 己[ji3], 庚[geng1], 辛[xin1], 壬[ren2], 癸[gui3], used cyclically in the calendar and as ordinal numbers I, II etc
six close relatives, namely: father 父[fu4], mother 母[mu3], older brothers 兄[xiong1], younger brothers 弟[di4], wife 妻[qi1], male children 子[zi3]/one's kin
the character 8 or 八/birthdate characters used in fortune-telling
one's fortune (in astrology)
to make money
Tai Sui, God of the year/archaic name for the planet Jupiter 木星[Mu4 xing1]/nickname for sb who is the most powerful in an area
menstruation/woman's period
